meanings.definition: Of or relating to youth or young people.
meanings.sent1: The neanic group of friends enjoyed playing at the park together.
meanings.sent2: She had a neanic enthusiasm for learning new things.
meanings.sent3: The neanic puppy tried to chase its own tail, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her neanic spirit shone brightly, bringing joy to those around her.
meanings.sent5: The neanic laughter of the children filled the room with happiness.

meanings.definition: Showing characteristics of youth or immaturity.
meanings.sent1: His neanic behavior sometimes got him into trouble at school.
meanings.sent2: The neanic artwork displayed vibrant colors and playful shapes.
meanings.sent3: The neanic prank they played on their teacher was harmless but funny.
meanings.sent4: The neanic decision to stay up all night seemed fun at first but led to exhaustion.
meanings.sent5: Her neanic giggle was contagious, making everyone smile.
